result.execSummary:
The defendant John Kenneth Williams was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Substantial Battery-Intend Bodily Harm [Modifiers: Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(2).
  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

from DOC requesting clarification of repeater enhancer in this case.

Defendant John Kenneth Williams in court with attorney Vincent Kurta.  Bruce Robert Poquette appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant entered plea of nc to counts 1 and 2.    DE advised of rights and penalties; DE waives rights; parties stipulate to facts.  Court finds defendant guilty of counts 1 and 2.

COURT:  Count 1 - Sentence w/held probation 3 years - AODA and any follow thru - No contact with Cindy Roalson - Absolute sobriety/no alcohol/drug use w/o valid RX - DNA sample/surcharge - Costs of $518.00 - any counseling DOC may impose - 15 CF 256 is dismissed and read in

Count 2: 30 days county jail to begin 3/4/16 at 3PM with huber and fine/costs of $673.60 - bail money to be applied to the fine
